title: Composition titles (books, song, plays, films etc)
Quoting Speech
value: All speech should be in double quotes

title: Apostrophes
value: Please ensure you word processor is set up to write xxxx apostrophes. The difference between xxxx and xxxx apostrophes is very small, but can be picked up by a keen eye in the printed magazine. It’s important this remains consistent.

title: Punctuation within quotes
value: The period and the comma always go within the quotation marks. The dash, semicolon, colon, question mark and exclamation point go within the quotation marks when they apply to the quoted matter only. They go outside when they apply to the whole sentence.

title: Dash
value: Use an EM dash whether for parentheses or to separate groups of words.

title: A word in another language
value: Use italics if not commonly used.

title: Measurements
value: Always use a space before m, km, ft etc

title: Double Space
value: We don’t use double space at the beginning of sentence.

title: Ellypsis
value: If someone trails off while speaking use “...”

title: Round brackets
value: Used as parentheses only when the sentence doesn’t make grammatical sense without.
